problem_text: Quadrilateral A B C D is shown. A C is 40 and B D is \frac { 3 } { 5 } A C. B D bisects A C. For what value of x is A B C D a parallelogram.
compact_text: Quadrilateral ABCD is shown. AC is 40 and BD is \frac{3}{5} AC. BD bisects AC. For what value of x is ABCD a parallelogram.
annotat_text: Quadrilateral ABCD is shown. AC is 40 and BD is $\frac{3}{5}$ AC . BD bisects AC. For what value of $x$ is ABCD a parallelogram.
